Description: Galactose:H+ symporter, GalP. Also transports glucose, xylose, fucose (6-deoxygalactose), 2-deoxygalactose and 2-deoxyglucose) (Henderson and Giddens 1977; Henderson et al. 1977; Hernández-Montalvo et al., 2001)
L-Fucose:H+
Fucose uptake porter FucABCD
Multiple sugar (arabinose, xylose, galactose, glucose, fucose)
Putative fucose-glucose oligosaccharide porter
ucose PTS uptake transporter (FcsABCD)
Putative fucose 4-O acetylase
Galactose:H+
Arabinose (xylose; galactose):H+
L-arabinose:proton symporter; Also transports xylose, galactose and α-1,5 arabinobiose
Glucose/galactose porter
The Na+-dependent sugar transporter, HP1174 (transports glucose, galactose, mannose and 2-deoxyglucose (Psakis et al. 2009)). (most similar to 2.A.1.7.2; 49% identity)
Galactose permease of 462 aas and 12 TMSs
Glucose or galactose:Na+ symporter
The putative galactose porter, GalPll (Rodionov et al., 2010).
Galactose/glucose (methyl galactoside) porter
Multiple sugar (arabinose, xylose, galactose, glucose, fucose)
The putative mannose porter, ManPl (Rodionov et al., 2010).
The putative mannose porter, ManP (Rodionov D.A., personal communication). Regulated by mannose regulon ManR.
Glucose/Mannose/Xylose: H+ symporter
The Na+-dependent sugar transporter, HP1174 (transports glucose, galactose, mannose and 2-deoxyglucose (Psakis et al. 2009)). (most similar to 2.A.1.7.2; 49% identity)
The putative mannose porter, ManPll (Rodionov et al. 2010).
The glucose/mannose porter TTC0326-8 plus MalK1 (ABC protein, shared with 3.A.1.1.25) (Chevance et al., 2006).
Fructose/mannose/ribose porter
Probable mannose/mannoside porter. Induced by beta-mannan (Conners et al., 2005). Regulated by mannose-responsive regulator manR (Kazanov et al., 2012).
The mannose porter (ManP) (Sun and Altenbuchner 2010)
The mannose (glucose, 2-deoxyglucose, glucosamine, N-acetylglucosamine, N-acetylmannosamine, mannosamine and fructose) PTS porter/group translocator, ManXYZ (Rephaeli and Saier 1980; Plumbridge 2015)
Mannose enzyme II complex, IIAB, IIC, IID. IIC/IID serve allows entry of some bacteriocins including pediocin (class IIa) and lactococcin A (class IIc) (Kjos et al., 2011)
The primary glucose /mannose uptake transporter, ManLMN (Aké et al. 2011).
Putative Mannose Enzyme II complex including IIA, IIB, IIC and IID; IIC has 231 aas and 6 TMSs.
PTS Mannose-like Enzyme II complex.  IIC, 257 aas and 6 TMSs.  Hits 4.A.6.2.1, 3.1 and 4.1 with scores of e-6 - e-12.
Glucose porter, ManLMN (Yebra et al., 2006)
The glucose/mannose/2-deoxyglucose/fructose phosphotransferase systems (phosphorylates without transport), ManLMN (Cochu et al., 2003)

Putative mannose/fructose/sorbose PTS Enzyme IIC of 304 aas with 11 predicted TMSs.  No IIA, IIB or IID domain for the mannose/sorbose PTS family was identified in the entire proteome of A. arabaticum.
Arabinose/xylose transporter, AraE (Wang et al. 2013).
Arabinose (xylose; galactose):H+ symporter, AraE (low affinity high capacity) (Khlebnikov et al. 2001).
L-arabinose:proton symporter, AraE (Sa-Nogueira and Ramos, 1997). Also transports xylose, galactose and α-1,5 arabinobiose (Ferreira and Sá-Nogueira, 2010).
Arabinose (but not xylose) and isopropyl β-D-thio-galactopyranoside:H+ antiporter, YdeA (Koita and Rao 2012).
The putative arabinose porter, AraP (Rodionov D.A., personal communication). Regulated by arabinose regulon AraR.
Predicted arabinoside porter. Regulated by arabinose-responsive regulator AraR (Rodionova et al.2012).
Putative L-arabinose porter (Rodionov et al. 2010).
Arabinose porter (Horazdovsky and Hogg 1989).
Multiple sugar (arabinose, xylose, galactose, glucose, fucose) putative porter

Galactose:H+ symporter, GalP. Also transports glucose, xylose, fucose (6-deoxygalactose), 2-deoxygalactose and 2-deoxyglucose) (Henderson and Giddens 1977; Henderson et al. 1977; Hernández-Montalvo et al., 2001)
Arabinose/xylose transporter, AraE (Wang et al. 2013).
Arabinose (xylose; galactose):H+ symporter, AraE (low affinity high capacity) (Khlebnikov et al. 2001).
Xylose (xylopyranose):H+ symporter of 491 aas and 12 TMSs (Wambo et al. 2017)
The D-xylose:H+ symporter, XylT (Km=220 μM; inhibited competitively by 6-deoxyglucose (Ki=220 μM), but not by other sugars tested) (Chaillou et al., 1998)
L-arabinose:proton symporter, AraE (Sa-Nogueira and Ramos, 1997). Also transports xylose, galactose and α-1,5 arabinobiose (Ferreira and Sá-Nogueira, 2010).
Glucose/Mannose/Xylose: H+ symporter (Paulsen et al., 1998; G.Gosset, personal communication).
Xylose porter (Nanavati et al. 2006). Regulated by xylose-responsive regulator XylR (Kazanov et al., 2012).
Xylose transporter, XylFGH (XylF (R), 359 aas; XylG (C), 525 aas; XylH (M), 389 aas
Xylose porter
Multiple sugar (arabinose, xylose, galactose, glucose, fucose) putative porter
Probable xylan oligosaccharide porter (Conners et al., 2005). Induced by xylan and xylose. Regulated by xylose-responsive regulator XylR (Kazanov et al. 2012).
OdpF (OccK2) glucuronate-selective porin; may also transport benzoate and vanillate (Eren et al., 2012). 3-d structure is known (3SZD).
Hexuronate (glucuronate; galacturonate) porter, ExuT (Nemoz et al. 1976).
The Aldohexuronate (glucuronate, galacturonate) uptake porter (Valmeekam et al. 2001).
The oligosaccharide (glucuronate-linked to a xylo-oligosaccharide) ABC uptake porter, GuoEFGK in AguEFGK.
